content_list.content:
Rocket Lawyer is among the best will-preparation tools available since it provides a streamlined method for developing legal documents.


Rocket Lawyer has one of the most efficient methods for creating legal documents on the market, making it a viable choice for drafting wills despite its primary mission is to provide reasonably priced legal services to small companies.


Pros


+ Provides valuable advisory services to its customers

+ Free articles that might be of assistance


Cons


- Designed with companies in mind

- Expensive unless you subscribe
content_list.subtitle: null

content_list.content:
· LLC service at no cost to members

· Members have access to legal counsel for their businesses

· Members get discounts on a variety of legal services and requirements.

· Free trial membership for the first week

· Phone, email, and live chat assistance are available

· Assurance of a full refund within 30 days

· Excellent reputation among customers served


Rocket Lawyer was established in 2008 to provide legal documents that could be produced and shared by anyone at a cost that was more affordable than hiring an attorney. Its founders wanted to create a company that provided legal documents that could be produced and shared by everyone. The business quickly grew to include other areas, such as the supply of do-it-yourself legal services, such as the creation of wills. Rocket Lawyer claims that it has assisted around 20 million individuals in the United States, including the creation of 165,000 wills.


Rocket Lawyer is a subscription service, which means they do not provide a one-time payment option to acquire their program. Rather, customers must pay a monthly fee. However, they provide a legal advice service; hence, although users may, in theory, draft a will without cost using their website, there is a fee for printing and distributing that document. The firm caters mostly to individuals running a small business, but there are some compelling reasons to choose them over the other top online will-creating software on the market.
content_list.subtitle: Key Specs

content_list.content:
· Model of doing business based on subscriptions

· The starting price is $39.99 per month


Rocket Lawyer may be one of the more costly options available on the market depending on the user's level of readiness and preparation and their efficiency in creating a will. This is because Rocket Lawyer is not a company that is particularly suitable for purchasing one-off legal documents. However, the procedure is one of the easiest ones available. As a result, producing a will may be accomplished for a cost that is not prohibitively expensive with a minimum of prior preparation.


Using Rocket Lawyer to draft a will is completely free of charge; however, non-subscribers will be charged $39.99 to save, print, and distribute the will they have created. There are additional fees that are imposed for non-members to pay. The cost of an attorney review is $9.99 while posing a query to one of their legal advisers will set you back $49.99, and a 30-minute consultation on a single legal topic would set you back $59.99.


Since a subscription to Rocket Lawyer is only $39.99 per month and includes all of these services at no extra cost, enrolling is financially beneficial, particularly if your will can be drafted in less than a month. Rocket Lawyer provides new users with a free trial that lasts for seven days, after which they can terminate their plan at any moment throughout their membership.
content_list.subtitle: Cost

content_list.content:
The only thing that Rocket Lawyer offers is a membership to their services, which can be purchased for $39.99 a month. There is also an annual edition and an "Accelerated" version. However, they are more geared toward the needs of small enterprises. For will preparation, the monthly membership should be sufficient. The cost of this service covers drafting a will and testament, using an attorney review service, providing answers to queries posed through email by legal experts, and scheduling 30-minute appointments with the same legal consultants.


In addition, the fee includes an unlimited number of document copies and edits. Cloud-based members get access to downloads in various formats, including Word, PDF, RTF, and text. Users participating in a free trial are restricted to downloading documents exclusively in PDF format.
content_list.subtitle: Products

content_list.content:
Rocket Lawyer's document preparation method is user-friendly and straightforward, making it straightforwardly similar to its competitors in the market. Because users' papers are created and stored in the cloud, no software has to be installed on their devices, and users may view their documents from any device as long as it has an internet connection.


Attorney Advice


Members who pay a monthly fee can access various administrative and legal assistance. In addition to providing customer support through email and phone, Rocket Lawyer's monthly subscriptions also include allotted time for live consultations with lawyers from the company's network. In addition, Rocket Lawyer provides a plethora of free legal-help articles that cover the fundamentals of every law aspect. These articles include several topics on the creation of wills and other aspects of estate planning. Anyone may read these articles without having to pay a fee.
content_list.subtitle: Document Creation

content_list.content:
Creating a will and testament using Rocket Lawyer is not too complicated, and the finished product is comparable to that of most of the company's rivals on the market. It does not provide a checklist like other programs, such as Quicken WillMaker, but it does include easily accessible asset spreadsheets, progress checks, and legal phrase glossaries.


Sample wills may be seen online at the Rocket Lawyer website, which is a helpful tool that users can use to assist them in the organization of their estates and provide them with ideas they would not have otherwise considered. The procedure is conducted in the form of an interview, as is the case with the vast majority of the software tools available for writing wills. Some questions are multiple-choice, while others require the user to fill in the text as they respond.


The steps are laid out in a way that is pleasing to the eye and extremely easy to understand and follow while using Rocket Lawyer. At any moment, you will have the option to save your work, and, should you want assistance from their online support staff, you will be able to either send an email to a lawyer of their customer care team or schedule a live consultation with one of their attorneys. Before the final document is printed, any number of revisions are available, and there are enough chances to evaluate the paper.


Before the final document is printed, any number of revisions are available, and there are enough chances to evaluate the paper. Rocket Lawyer provides a fair number of tools and support choices. The procedure ought to provide few challenges for anybody who has done even the barest minimum of preparatory work. Since the Better Business Bureau first granted its accreditation in 2006, Rocket Lawyer has consistently maintained the organization's highest possible grade of "A+."
content_list.subtitle: Usability

content_list.content:
The incorporation services provided by Rocket Lawyer are comparable to the LLC services it offers. You'll be able to establish an S Corp, C Corp, or non-profit company by using the program. To reiterate, all you need to get started is to provide straightforward responses to a few questions about your company. Although the answers to these questions may vary significantly from those that pertain to LLCs, the information provided here is nevertheless broad. You are also given access to incorporation specialists when you use rocket lawyer, which may be helpful if you want further assistance while the signup procedure is completed.


The incorporation service provided by Rocket Lawyer has a fee of $99. However, if you join the premium membership, you won't have to pay for it. You are free to decide whether or not you would want to employ Rocket Lawyer as your registered agent. Rocket Lawyer will handle the preparation of your S company election form for a fee of $69 if you decide to be taxed as an S corporation. EIN services are offered at $59.99.
content_list.subtitle: Incorporation Services

content_list.content:
Several online legal services allow you to chat with a lawyer over the phone, but only a chosen handful, such as Rocket Lawyer, provides online question-and-answer sessions. Rocket Lawyer's "on-call" lawyers allow users to submit any legal query they may have online and get a response from an experienced legal professional. These lawyers have a variety of areas of expertise, including contract law, intellectual property law, and company law, and they provide precise and trustworthy legal advice. This rapid legal assistance may be a huge benefit for time-strapped company owners and entrepreneurs who are unable to find time to jump on a call with a lawyer.



Intuitive Form Builder


Putting together individualized legal papers and contracts has never been simpler than with Rocket Lawyer's user-friendly form builder. Users are required to respond to several questions about their company, and after they do so, a series of pop-up windows will show on their screen, educating them about the legal requirements in your state. This guarantees that your form conforms with state law and may be used as evidence in a legal proceeding.

Using Rocket Lawyer to establish a limited liability company is most beneficial if you intend to use the company's other offerings, such as access to an attorney and legal documents. Rocket Lawyer does not provide free assistance with the establishment of LLCs, but if you retain your membership for only one month, you will only be charged $39.99. The most affordable price for forming a company with ZenBusiness is $49. Meanwhile, Inc Authority will organize your documents without charging you a single cent (except for state filing fees).


Rocket Lawyer charges around $50 more than Inc Authority and ZenBusiness for their registered agent services; however, both Inc Authority and ZenBusiness provide more affordable options. On the other hand, neither ZenBusiness nor Inc Authority provides its members access to legal papers and attorneys via their subscriptions, although Rocket Lawyer does.
content_list.subtitle: How Rocket Lawyer Compares to Other Services

content_list.content:
You will be required to pay costs to file your business with the state, regardless of which company you decide to work with to assist you in forming your firm. Through Rocket Lawyer's seven-day free trial, you get access to free legal paperwork and the ability to ask a lawyer a question at no further cost to you. If you require the company's services for more than a week or if you want assistance submitting the papers necessary for the establishment of your LLC, the fee will be $39.99 per month.


If you decide to be a non-member of Rocket Lawyer and pay for LLC formation and registered agent services on your own, the price of using Rocket Lawyer might be rather high. If you do not need any further legal paperwork or to speak with a lawyer, it is possible that you would be better off selecting a different LLC provider. If you need those extra services, the minimal monthly charge can be more than worth it to ensure that your company is compliant with all applicable legal requirements.
content_list.subtitle: Is Rocket Lawyer the Appropriate Choice for You or Your Company?

content_list.content: Although Rocket Lawyer is primarily a law firm that specializes in handling ongoing legal concerns for small companies, the will-drafting software they provide offers a few perks worth considering. It is possible to draft a Last Will and Testament without cost by taking advantage of their free trial period, which lasts for seven days. After that, you may become a subscriber by paying the one-time fee required to access all of their support services. Their user interface is intuitive, and flexibility is offered in terms of the number of revisions and the variety of formats in which the final document may be shared among the finest currently on the market.
content_list.subtitle: Is It Recommended That You Go With Rocket Lawyer?
